results.title: Hangman
results.creator_credit: Les Goldman, Paul Julian and Melrose Productions
results.brief_description: Follows Maurice Ogden’s allegorical poem. A hangman executes the inhabitants of a tow, one by one, without explanation. Fed by the blood of the victims no-one defended - the alien, the one who dared to object, and the Jew - the gallows tree takes root and fills the village square. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Brisbane 1982: the twelfth Commonwealth Games
results.creator_credit: Terence McMahon and Terence McMahon Productions
results.brief_description: Produced as part of Comalco’s sponsorship of the Commonwealth Games to be held in Brisbane in 1982. Includes historic newsreel footage of major performances by Australians in the past Commonwealth Games. Also shows some of Australia’s athletes training for the 1982 Games.

results.title: Enough guts to say no
results.creator_credit: Virginia Westbury, Paul Griffiths, National Heart Foundation of Australia and Paul Griffiths Presentations
results.brief_description: Designed to show teenagers that their desire to smoke is a subtle manipulation of their desire to belong and be accepted. Non-smoking teenagers demonstrate that liking and being liked is not related to smoking and that potential friends may be turned off by it.

results.title: The Care we take
results.creator_credit: Tim Sullivan, Bruce Moir, Film House Company and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Provides a comprehensive look at the Australian barley industry in South Australia and Victoria as controlled by the Australian Barley Board. Deals with all aspects from research and growing to marketing and final uses of barley. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: A Fair go in life
results.brief_description: Looks at the operation of the Supplementary Grants Program at Springvale Primary School, a disadvantage school. Notes in particular the process involved in opening the lines of communication between the school and the community.

results.title: Japan invades China: crisis in the Far East
results.creator_credit: Anthony Potter, Michael D. Ornstein and Alan Landsburg Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how Japan, encouraged by lack of Western resistance took control of French Indochina, the Dutch Indies, Burma, Malaya and the Philippines. Roosevelt attempted to counter Japan’s escalating aggression, and by mid-1941, a total embargo was enforced and all assets originating in Japan were frozen on the market. In the face of this pressure, the Japanese government forced the United States into war. Narrated by Eric Sevareid. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Italian-Ethiopian war: Africa in world affairs
results.creator_credit: Anthony Potter, William Kronick, Alan Landsburg Productions and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Centres on the Italian Ethiopian war of 1935-1936 to lead into an examination of Italian fascism, the character of Mussolini, and how he came to power. Shows how the conflict was one of the chief episodes that paved the way for World War 2. Seen from an essentially American perspective, this film combines contemporaneous actuality footage and interviews with US academics. Written by Anthony Potter. This film is suitable for Upper Secondary levels.

results.title: Fundamentals of squash: Basic shots & tactics
results.brief_description: Emphasizes the importance of controlling the centre court position and the awareness of position in relation to one’s opponent. Demonstrates the cross-court angle, corner drop, and lob shots.
